metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9114 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
Blkid in util-linux before 2.26rc-1 allows local users to execute arbitrarycode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9114` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdextrautils - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
eject - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
fdisk - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
libblkid1 - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
libfdisk1 - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
libmount1 - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
libsmartcols1 - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
libuuid1 - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
mount - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
rfkill - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
util-linux - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
util-linux-extra - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
util-linux-locales - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
uuid-runtime - 2.38.1-4ubuntu1
bsdutils - 1:2.38.1-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.2-6ubuntu1').
util-linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.2-6ubuntu1').
